**Tender Announcement: Fisgard Lighthouse Causeway Rehabilitation**
====================================================================

### Tender Information

* **Title:** Stage 1 - Fisgard Lighthouse Causeway Rehabilitation, Fisgard Lighthouse National Historic Site
* **Reference Number:** cb-120-47759647
* **Amendment Number:** 2
* **Solicitation Number:** 5P468-24-0010/A
* **Publication Date:** 2024-05-03
* **Tender Closing Date and Time:** 2024-05-21T16:00:00
* **Contracting Entity:** Parks Canada
* **Contact Information:**
	+ Phone: (431) 335-6240
	+ Email: [John.Umuerri@pc.gc.ca](mailto:John.Umuerri@pc.gc.ca)
	+ Fax: 1-855-983-1808

### Project Description

Parks Canada requires the rehabilitation of the existing causeway connecting Fort Rodd Hill National Historic Site to Fisgard Lighthouse in Colwood, BC. The project involves (1) the placement of filter rock and rip-rap armoring rock to increase the dimensions of the causeway, and (2) constructing an asphalt road along the crest of the causeway. The project scope includes work below and above the high-water mark, with specific considerations for environmental and fisheries concerns.

**Important Notes:**

* Bids received by fax and email will be accepted as official.
* Parks Canada is not accepting bids via SAP Ariba; bidders must submit their bid via fax or email as indicated in the solicitation document.
* The only acceptable email address for responses to the bid solicitation is soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca.
* Bidders must ensure that their email attachment size does not exceed 15 megabytes.

### Evaluation Process

This is a two-stage selection process. Bidders will be evaluated based on their qualifications and competencies in Stage 1, followed by a financial evaluation in Stage 2. The evaluation process will assess the bidder's ability to meet the project requirements and deliver the work as per the specifications and drawings.

**Detailed Information**

For detailed information, including project plans and drawings, bidder queries, and instructions to bidders, please refer to the solicitation document and supporting attachments available on the Government of Canada tendering service at [http://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities](http://can
